resources.string: Your record has not been added!

The list of the 235 butterflies of Greece with species included in: THE RED BOOK OF THREATENED ANIMALS OF GREECE (and STATUS), Numa et. al for Mediterranean butterflies, THE LAW IN GREECE, CITES, BERNE CONVENTION and 92/43 HABITATS DIRECTIVE of EU\nSome of the butterflies (with YELLOW fill in cells) are under a special protection in Greece.
Photographs of the Butterflies of Greece for identification in the field

In order to make the identification of the butterflies in the field easier we present here 476 photographs. We present 165 new photographs taken from 2009-2015 while the rest 311 photographs have been published in the book. These photographs can be found in the field tab.\nIn this application you can find:

There is a selection of photographs for identification of the 237 butterflies of Greece in the field. You can navigate from families to species and then to the photos. Just tap on a family, or a specie, or a photo thumbnail. You can also extract images on a pdf file. Just tap the PLUS icon in order to add an image or all images of a specie or a family. Once you have selected all the images you want, tap the export button and choose the size of the exported photos. A search option is also included in the photographs of the field section.

In Legacy section, you can find detailed instructions from the Ministry of Environment for how to make an application and obtain a permission for research, investigation, photography, cinematography, collecting, capturing and exporting from Greece animals and plants (including butterflies). The application should be addressed to: Ministry for Environment and Energy, Directorate General for the Protection and Development of Forests and the Rural Environment, Directorate of Forest Management, Halkokondili 31, 104 32 Athens GREECE e-mail: diaxeirisi.dason@gmail.com. You can also find this information in https://yperdiavgeia.gr/decisions/downloadPdf/15680414
Information about the author of the book: ΤΗΕ BUTTERFLIES OF GREECE

Your records of the butterflies of Greece could be very useful for the protection of the butterflies and the environment in Greece. Keep your records and photographs taken always accompanied with the exact locality, coordinates (latitude and longitude) and altitude (m). Also keep any other information associated with the butterflies (eg number individuals of males or females seen, mating behavior, host plants etc). You can add this information in the contribute section. Use the form and the insert button to store data in your device and tap the export button in order to print all your records in a pdf file. You can then send this file alongside with your photos to the author pamperis@otenet.gr

The are notes for those of the 235 species of the butterflies of Greece, which are listed in various lists, for protection and study in Greece: 
1. Twenty nine species are listed in: ΛΕΓΑΚΙΣ, ΑΝΑΣΤΑΣΙΟΣ: Ασπόνδυλα. In: ΛΕΓΑΚΙΣ Α. και Π. Μαραγκού (επιμέλεια έκδοσης), Το κόκκινο βιβλίο των απειλούμενων Ζώων της Ελλάδας. Ελληνική Ζωωλογική Εταιρεία. Αθήνα 2009 
2. Three species are listed in: NUMA, C., et al (2016). The status and distribution of Mediterranean butterflies. IUCN, Malaga, Spain. x + 32 pp.3. 
3. Forty three species are listed in: ΠΔ 67/1981 
4. One species are listed in: CITES 
5. Eight species are listed in: BERNE CONVENTION Appendix II 
6. Three species are listed in: 92/43 HABITATS DIRECTIVE ANNEX II 
7. Nine species are listed in: 92/43 HABITATS DIRECTIVE ANNEX IV

In this Application your photograph can be recognized by a system designed to compare photos with AI (Artificial Intelligence). My personal database of photographs had been used for training the AI system. Accuracy can be further improved by adding more identified photos from the users. Users of this page are invited to upload their photos for recognition and then send them to contribute to the better training of the AI system. The more photographs in the training set, the bigger the accuracy of the system. The results for some of the 235 species of butterflies of Greece are presented grouped in complexes; the reasons for this is that there are limits in identification using only photographs as input, in this AI (=Artificial Intelligence) system. For the moment recognition in the following species is not accurate: 
 
• Pieris napi / balcana complex 
• Colias crocea / erate complex 
• Lepidea sinapis / juvernica complex 
• Plebejus argus / idas / argyrognomon complex 
• Polyommatus ripartii / timfristos complex 
• Melitaea athalia / aurelia complex 
• Hipparchia fagi / syriaca complex 
• Hipparchia senthes / volgensis / cretica / christenseni / mersina complex 
• Pseudochazara anthelea / amalthea complex 
• Maniola telmessia / chia / hallicarnassus complex 
• Gegenes pumilio / nostrodamus complex. 
 
Identification of the above species could be improved only after a discovery of new crucial characters on the wings and better AI system. It is recommended that users, before resorting to the Application, first search for the answer in their books, on various websites, etc., and then resort to the Application to confirm their conclusion. The research in the field, the suffering of the effort with perseverance and patience, the contact with the relevant books is the sure but uphill way, to improve in the recognition of the butterflies. Quick Recognition with Application is good but do not blindly trust it and always doubt the results.
